intro: Aristida orcuttiana, commonly known as Orcutt's threeawn, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, sandy conditions. Due to its adaptability, it is considered an important component of local ecosystems in its native range.
